com.eim.utility.statistics.utility
Class StatisticsValueComputer

java.lang.Object
  com.eim.utility.statistics.utility.StatisticsValueComputer

public class StatisticsValueComputer
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class that handles the assignments of statistics to the statistics objects but also provides a set computation methods.

Author:
sdj

getJensenAlpha

public static java.lang.Double getJensenAlpha(com.dst.timeserie.TimeSeries workingSeries,
                                              com.dst.timeserie.TimeSeries benchmarkSeries,
                                              com.dst.timeserie.TimeSeries rfrSeries,
                                              com.dst.timeserie.TimeSerie betaTS,
                                              boolean webfolio)
A method that computes the Jensen's alpha. It is called by the computeRFRValues method.
That method handles several computation mode. That mode is selected by the webfolio flag.
If true, the Jensen's Alpha is computed as in Webfolio (average gains).
If false, the Jensen's Alpha is computed as stated in financial handbooks (effective gains). It doesn't have any impact on the computation speed.

Parameters:
statistic - The statistic to update
workingSeries - The complete DST TimeSeries
benchmarkSeries - The complete DST TimeSeries of the benchmark
rfrSeries - The complete DST TimeSeries of the RFR benchmark
betaTS - The complete DST TimeSerie of betas
webfolio - Indicates which computation mode has to be used
Returns:
The Jensen's alpha value

getAverageGainFromPerformances

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getAverageGainFromPerformances(java.util.List<com.dst.timeserie.TimeSerie> timeseries)
Method used by the Jensen's alpha computation method when called in Webfolio mode.

Parameters:
timeseries - The list of timeseries to use
Returns:
The list of average gains from performances.

getReturnsFromPerformances

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getReturnsFromPerformances(java.util.List<com.dst.timeserie.TimeSerie> timeseries)
Method used by the Jensen's alpha computation method when not called in Webfolio mode.

Parameters:
timeseries - The list of timeseries to use
Returns:
The list of effective returns from performances.

computeValuesAtRisk

public static double[] computeValuesAtRisk(double[] vector,
                                           int startRange,
                                           int endRange)
Computes all V@R.
V@Rs are stored in an array with indices representing values as follow:
  • 0 - Historical CVaR
  • 1 - Simulated CVaR
  • 2 - VaR_1_12
  • 3 - VaR 95
  • 4 - VaR 99

Parameters:
vector - The source vector
startRange - The start range
endRange - The end range
Returns:
The set of V@R
